1.text: My son, if thou art become surety for thy neighbor, If thou hast stricken thy hands for a stranger;

2.text: Thou art snared with the words of thy mouth, Thou art taken with the words of thy mouth.

3.text: Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, Seeing thou art come into the hand of thy neighbor: Go, humble thyself, and importune thy neighbor;

4.text: Give not sleep to thine eyes, Nor slumber to thine eyelids;

5.text: Deliver thyself as a roe from the hand of the hunter, And as a bird from the hand of the fowler.

6.text: Go to the ant, thou sluggard; Consider her ways, and be wise:

7.text: Which having no chief, Overseer, or ruler,

8.text: Provideth her bread in the summer, And gathereth her food in the harvest.

9.text: How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? When wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?

10.text: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, A little folding of the hands to sleep:

11.text: So shall thy poverty come as a robber, And thy want as an armed man.

12.text: A worthless person, a man of iniquity, Is he that walketh with a perverse mouth;

13.text: That winketh with his eyes, that speaketh with his feet, That maketh signs with his fingers;

14.text: In whose heart is perverseness, Who deviseth evil continually, Who soweth discord.

15.text: Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly; On a sudden shall he be broken, and that without remedy.

16.text: There are six things which Jehovah hateth; Yea, seven which are an abomination unto him:

17.text: Haughty eyes, a lying tongue, And hands that shed innocent blood;

18.text: A heart that deviseth wicked purposes, Feet that are swift in running to mischief,

19.text: A false witness that uttereth lies, And he that soweth discord among brethren.

20.text: My son, keep the commandment of thy father, And forsake not the law of thy mother:

21.text: Bind them continually upon thy heart; Tie them about thy neck.

22.text: When thou walkest, it shall lead thee; When thou sleepest, it shall watch over thee; And when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.

23.text: For the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light; And reproofs of instruction are the way of life:

24.text: To keep thee from the evil woman, From the flattery of the foreigner’s tongue.

25.text: Lust not after her beauty in thy heart; Neither let her take thee with her eyelids.

26.text: For on account of a harlot a man is brought to a piece of bread; And the adulteress hunteth for the precious life.

27.text: Can a man take fire in his bosom, And his clothes not be burned?

28.text: Or can one walk upon hot coals, And his feet not be scorched?

29.text: So he that goeth in to his neighbor’s wife; Whosoever toucheth her shall not be unpunished.

30.text: Men do not despise a thief, if he steal To satisfy himself when he is hungry:

31.text: But if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold; He shall give all the substance of his house.

32.text: He that committeth adultery with a woman is void of understanding: He doeth it who would destroy his own soul.

33.text: Wounds and dishonor shall he get; And his reproach shall not be wiped away.

34.text: For jealousy is the rage of a man; And he will not spare in the day of vengeance.

35.text: He will not regard any ransom; Neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts.
